name: tie
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fasten together two ends of a piece of string or other long, thin material, or to (cause to) hold together with a long, thin piece of string, material, etc.

example.eg: Could you tie this piece of string for me?
example.egtrans: 你能帮我把这个绳子打个结吗？

example.eg: This skirt ties at the waist.
example.egtrans: 这条连衣裙是在腰间系带的。

example.eg: She tied the ribbon tightly in a bow/knot.
example.egtrans: 她把丝带打成一个紧紧的蝴蝶结。

example.eg: I tie my hair back when it's hot.
example.egtrans: 天热时我就把头发系在脑后。

example.eg: Tie (up) your shoelaces, or you'll trip over them.
example.egtrans: 把鞋带系好，不然会摔跤的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to force someone to stay in a place

example.eg: I felt tied to the job while I had a mortgage to pay.
example.egtrans: 因为有按揭贷款要还，我感到自己被这份工作束缚住了。

example.eg: Her job ties her to the east coast.
example.egtrans: 她的工作把她约束在东海岸。

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to relate to or connect to

example.eg: Is the allergy tied to dairy products, for example?
example.egtrans: 比如说，过敏症与奶制品有关系吗？

example.eg: Can you tie his behaviour up with anything that's happened recently?
example.egtrans: 你认为他的行为与最近发生的什么事有关联吗？

example.eg: The Republicans are trying to tie the funding up with this bill.
example.egtrans: 共和党试图把资金与这项法案联系起来。

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to finish at the same time or score the same number of points, etc. in a competition as someone or something else

example.eg: Jane and I tied (for first place) in the spelling test.
example.egtrans: 在拼写比赛中（争夺第一名时）我和简打成平手。

example.eg: We tied with a team from the south in the championships.
example.egtrans: 在锦标赛中我们和一支南方队打成平手。

name: tie
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin piece of material that is worn under a shirt collar, especially by men, and tied in a knot at the front

example.eg: He always wears a jacket and tie to work.
example.egtrans: 他上班时总是穿西服打领带。

trans_examp.trans_en: any piece of string, plastic, metal, etc. that is used to fasten or hold together something

example.eg: Can you see the ties for the rubbish bags in the cupboard?
example.egtrans: 你看到柜子里扎垃圾袋的带子了吗？

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the friendly feelings that people have for other people, or special connections with places

example.eg: Family ties are weaker if you move a long way away.
example.egtrans: 离家太远就会与家人疏远。

example.eg: I no longer feel any ties with my home town.
example.egtrans: 我对我的家乡再也没有任何亲切感了。

example.eg: He urged governments worldwide to break diplomatic ties with the new regime.
example.egtrans: 他敦促世界各国政府断绝与新政权的外交关系。

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which two or more people finish at the same time or score the same number of points

example.eg: It's a tie for first place.
They have changed the scoring system because there have been too many ties.
example.egtrans: 因为常常出现不分胜负的结果，他们改变了计分制。
